sentence.Network_en: He spun the steering-wheel so that we yawed from side to side.
sentence.Network_cn: 他急速打着舵轮，把我们搞得摇来晃去的。

sentence.Network_en: He downshifted and turned the steering wheel.
sentence.Network_cn: 他调到低速挡，转动方向盘。

sentence.Network_en: The overdrive switch was on the steering column.
sentence.Network_cn: 超速挡的开关在转向杆上。

entry.def: The steering in a car or other vehicle is the mechanical parts of it which make it possible to steer.
A steering committee or a steering group is a group of people that organizes the early stages of a project, and makes sure it progresses in a satisfactory way.

example.ex: There will be an economic steering committee with representatives of each of the republics.
example.tran: 将设立一个由各共和国代表组成的经济指导委员会。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of guiding or showing the way
2. the act of setting and holding a course;

sentences.sentence: "a new council was installed under the direction of the king"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of steering a ship
